result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs to be paid $25.00 per month commencing 08/01/22 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Simpson

records.addlTxt: End of representation letter filed by Atty. Kees.

09:33 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Christopher J Simpson in court with attorney Anna M Kees.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the plea questionnaire has been filed and inquires how the matter is proceeding.  Atty. Kees confirms her client is prepared to proceed to plea and sentencing.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Kees confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2.  Court orders Count 3 dismissed and read in.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Kees.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 2:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of:

1 Day Jail (Credit - 1 day) **TIME SERVED**

FINE:  $316.00;

DNA Surcharge: $200.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 08/01/2022. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:05 AM Defendant Christopher J Simpson in court with attorney Anna M Kees.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Attorney Kees is requesting a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Letter dated 05-06-22 requesting hearing be removed and future plea and sentencing date.  ** Reviewed by Judge Lau on 5/9/22 - Hearing to stay on as scheduled.**
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to have no contact with Witness A/Extended Stay/co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:39 AM Defendant Christopher J Simpson in court.  Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion and Order To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Lau.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal,  by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
